generalInfo: May cause complications in jaundiced neonates and infants.

hepaticImpairment.specificInfo: Better to avoid in severe hepatic impairment.

generalInfo: Avoid in the first trimester due to potential teratogenicity; use only if clearly needed later in pregnancy.

renalImpairment.specificInfo: Reduce dose in moderate to severe renal impairment.

sideEffects.specificInfo: Common: Nausea; diarrhoea; rash; hyperkalaemia; Headache; dizziness; Uncommon: vomiting; pruritus. Rare: loss of appetite; photosensitivity;  agranulocytosis, thrombocytopenia, haemolytic anaemia, aplastic anaemia; aseptic meningitis; pancreatitis; interstitial nephritis; Stevensâ€“Johnson syndrome (SJS); toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN); erythema multiforme; serum sickness. Frequency Not Known: drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS).
